Description: Fragment of upper wall of Attic black-figured pottery oenochoe. Upper part of interior glazed (fired orange). Exterior: linked buds with intersticial dots in frieze above panel; warrior facing left, spear raised; white dots on crest-holder; to his right part of a draped bearded male, facing left; much added red on both figures.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Also illustrated in Bothmer, D. von, The Amasis Painter and his World (Malibu, 1985) 159, no. 35.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (IIIh pl. 3, 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1214)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
